title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
description: A traditional Italian pasta dish made with eggs, hard cheese, cured pork, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
In a separate pan, crisp up the pancetta.
In a bowl, whisk eggs with cheese and black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving some pasta water. Add pasta to the pan with pancetta. Stir well.
Remove from heat and quickly pour the egg mixture over the pasta, stirring vigorously to create a creamy sauce. Add pasta water as needed.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and pepper.

title: French Toast
description: A sweet and comforting breakfast made with bread soaked in a milky egg mixture and fried.
instructions: Whisk eggs, milk, sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon in a shallow dish.
Dip each slice of bread into the mixture, ensuring both sides are coated.
Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook bread slices for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown.
Serve warm with syrup, fruit, or powdered sugar.

title: Fresh Garden Salad
description: A light and healthy salad with crisp lettuce, fresh vegetables, and a simple vinaigrette.
ingredients: For dressing: olive oil, vinegar, salt, pepper
instructions: Wash and chop all vegetables.
Toss the chopped vegetables in a large bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together the dressing ingredients.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: A timeless classic! Soft, chewy cookies with melted chocolate chips in every bite.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, cream together butter and sugars.
Beat in the egg and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto baking sheets.
Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until edges are golden brown.

title: Creamy Tomato Soup
description: A comforting and smooth tomato soup, perfect for a cold day.
instructions: In a large pot, sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add diced tomatoes and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Stir in heavy cream and season with salt and pepper.
Serve warm, optionally with croutons or fresh herbs.

title: Grilled Salmon with Asparagus
description: A simple and healthy dinner that's quick to prepare and packed with flavor.
instructions: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Toss asparagus with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
Grill salmon for 4-6 minutes per side, depending on thickness.
Grill asparagus for 3-5 minutes, until tender-crisp.
Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the salmon and asparagus before serving.

title: Banana Bread
description: A moist and delicious bread perfect for breakfast or a snack, a great way to use up overripe bananas.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a bowl, mix mashed bananas and melted butter.
Stir in the egg, sugar, and vanilla.
Sprinkle baking soda and salt over the mixture and mix.
Stir in the flour until just combined.
Pour batter into a greased loaf pan.
Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.

title: Avocado Toast
description: A simple and trendy breakfast or snack with mashed avocado on toasted bread.
instructions: Toast the bread to your liking.
Slice the avocado in half and mash the flesh in a small bowl.
Spread the mashed avocado evenly on the toast.
Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes if desired.

title: Hearty Lentil Soup
description: A satisfying and nutritious soup, packed with lentils and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 cup brown or green lentils, rinsed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add onion, carrots, and celery and cook until soft.
Add garlic and cook for another minute.
Stir in rinsed lentils, vegetable broth, bay leaf, and diced tomatoes.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes, until lentils are tender.
Remove the bay leaf and season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Beef Stir-Fry
description: A quick and delicious stir-fry with tender beef and crisp vegetables in a savory sauce.
instructions: In a bowl, toss sliced beef with 1 tbsp soy sauce and cornstarch. Let sit for 10 minutes.
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Add beef and stir-fry until browned. Remove from skillet.
Add vegetables to the skillet and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Return beef to the skillet. Pour in remaining soy sauce and stir to coat.
Serve hot over rice.

title: Blueberry Muffins
description: Classic, fluffy muffins bursting with fresh blueberries.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) and line a muffin tin.
In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder.
In another bowl, whisk oil, egg, and milk.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Gently fold in blueberries.
Scoop batter into muffin cups. Bake for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown.

title: Lemon Bars
description: A zesty and sweet dessert with a buttery shortbread crust and a tangy lemon filling.
ingredients: For crust: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup cold butter, 1/4 cup powdered sugar
For filling: 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbsp all-purpose flour, 1/4 tsp baking powder, 2 large eggs, 1/4 cup lemon juice
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
For the crust, mix flour and powdered sugar. Cut in cold butter until crumbly. Press into a 9x9 inch pan and bake for 15-20 minutes.
For the filling, whisk sugar, flour, and baking powder. Add eggs and lemon juice, whisking until smooth.
Pour filling over the hot crust and bake for 20-25 minutes, until set.
Let cool completely before dusting with powdered sugar and cutting into bars.
